intro: Armeria canescens f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered thrift, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with dense clusters of small, white flowers. The plant features silver-gray foliage due to a dense covering of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value and resilience in harsh conditions.
